page.description: Convert javascript object data to strict JSON, useful when copying snippets from javascript.

section.description: Converts a JSON string to 'strict' JSON syntax - Javascript objects can be created from literal definitions that do not follow the strict JSON syntax. For example:

However the JSON.parse() function can only parse strict JSON strings. Similarly, on the server-side, the Xbasic json_parse() function can parse JSON strings that do not follow the strict syntax. However, many of the other Xbasic JSON functions (e.g. Json_extract() ) require strict syntax. The Json_sanitize() function will convert a JSON string to strict syntax
